The total mass of the Earth's hydrosphere is about 1.4 Ã 10 18 tonnes,
which is about 0.023% of the Earth's total mass. About 20 Ã 10 12
tonnes of this is in the Earth's atmosphere (the volume of one tonne of water is
approximately 1 cubic metre). Approximately 75% of the Earth's surface, an area
of some 361 million square kilometers (139.5 million square miles), is covered
by ocean. The average salinity of the Earth's oceans is about 35 grams of
salt per kilogram of sea water (3.5%) {{cite book
